acts.act: Protection of children from sexual offence act 2012

business_details.Business: Accused Shyam Thapa is produced from jail hazat and further remanded till next date.         Fixing 16.10.2019 for production   Copy                                                  C/C
PO is on long vacation. Accused person is produced from jail hazot and further remanded till next date.

Accused Sri Shyam Thapa is produced from the jail hazot and he is again remanded till next date. Copy is furnish to him.        Having very carefully gone through the submission duly advanced by the learned lawyers of the both sides as well as case diary I find there is a ground for presuming that the accused committed the offence under sections 363 of the IPC/4 of the POCSO Act and accordingly the charges are framed. The particular of the offence charged is duly read over and explained to the accused person to which he pleaded not guilty and claimed to be tried. Issue summons to PWs.        Seen the bail petition filed by one Sri Pratap Thapa praying for allowing the accused Sri Shyam Thapa to go on bail on the ground stated in the petition supported by an affidavit. Heard learned lawyers of the both sides. Perused the case record. The accused has been in the jail hazot since 09.08.2019. The charge sheet has been submitted within the mandatory detention period. However for the ends of Justice the bail prayer is allowed. Accordingly the accused Shri Shyam Thapa is allowed to go on bail of Rs. 30,000/- with two local sureties of like amount on the condition that during the trial he shall not make any endorsement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the case so as to dissuade him/ them from disclosing such a fact to the Court or temper with the evidence
accused present.PWs absent. Summons not returned. Issue fresh

Accused Shri Shyam Thapa is present. Summons issued to PWs Shri Munna Busfor and Shri Babu Teria returned after being served. Seen the service report. Issue BWA of Rs. 1000/- against them.           Seen the petition filed by the accused praying for allowing him to take custody of the mobile handsets of Galaxy J Max Samsung Tablet Phone and another Lava handset which were seized in connection with this case. Heard learned lawyers of the both sides. Perused the case record. From the case record it appears that one Galaxy J Max Samsung Table Phone and other Lava handsets along with SIM cards were seized in connection with this case from the possession of the accused/petitioner. Charge sheet has been submitted. Seen the cash memo of Mobile handset of Galaxy J Max Samsung Tablet Phone. Taking all aspects into consideration, the prayer is partially allowed. Accordingly the accused/petitioner is allowed to take custody of seized mobile handset of Galaxy J Max Samsung Tablet along with SIM Casrd vide N0. 7005892412 on execution of a bond of Rs. 5000/-.          Fixing 21.01.2020 for evidence.
Accused Shyam Thapa is present.    PW Munna Basfor is present. He is examined, cross-examined and discharged. Issue summons to rest PWs.         Fixing 04.03.20 for  Further/Evidence.
CR recd on transfer with CD from Hon DJKA for disposal.        accd Shyam Thapa present,      one PW present who was cross examined and discharged,       issue summons to rest PWs
Court work is disrupted due to Covid-19.
